* Returns the date which task takes place

* Returns the current status icon of whether the task is done

private static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Returns the number of tasks in ArrayList
* Returns all the tasks in ArrayList
* @param tasks makes up the array list of task.
* @param count is now the number of tasks in array list.
* Prints out all the tasks in the array list.
* Each task printed out is numbered.
System.out.println("     Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints out message that the task has been marked done.
* Print out the task as well.
* @param index indicates the task number which the user has marked done.
public static void displayTaskDone(int index) throws DukeException {
System.out.println("      Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
* Prints out message that the task has been removed from the list.
* Removes the task from the list.
* @param index indicates the task number which the user has deleted.
System.out.println("      Noted. I've removed this task:  ");
* Adds todo task to array list
* @param command consists of task description to be added to array list.
System.out.println("     Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Adds event task to array list
* @param command consists of task description to be added to array list.
System.out.println("     Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
* Adds deadline task to array list
* @param command consists of task description to be added to array list.
System.out.println("     Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
* Adds the task to array list.
* @param a indicates task to be added.
System.out.println("     Got it. I've added this task: ");

* Returns a String representation of the task including the status icon and description
* Prints Duke logo and welcome message.
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
* Prints border that is used to outline messages to the user by duke.
* Prints farewell message when exiting Duke.
System.out.println("     Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints message of the filepath the text file is located at.
* @param filepath filepath of the text file location used to save tasks.
System.out.print("     I've created a text file at \" ");
* Prints error message when invalid command is input by the user.
System.out.println("     ERROR: there is no such command, try again!");
* Prints error message when user does not specify the task number when inputting "done" command.
System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! Please specify which task number is done");
* Prints error message when user inputs a non-existent the task number in "done" command.
System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! There is no such task number");
* Prints error message when user inputs a task number that has already been marked as done in "done" command.
System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! This task is already marked as done");
